just think, I'm 172 days pregnant now!! (6 months!) That means I haven't written in 102 days! tut tut!

life has been good, I has a great trip in Canada, I was there for about 6 weeks. I grew out of my "normal" clothes about a week into the trip! :) got to do some shopping!

spent time in The Pas, Winnipeg, Melfort, Saskatoon, Airdrie, Calgary, Vancouver...but not enough time in any of those places!

Now I'm back in Shanghai, teaching grade 2! It was hot when we got here, but now the weather is great! t shirts and capris weather all the way! :)

we got internet a week ago in our apartment, so I should be more faithful to the journal, and I'll be updating pictures soon!! 

the biggest news is probably that we went ahead and got an ultrasound a few weeks ago! our first! it was so awesome to see our little boy moving around, looking healthy and active! :)
 thats about it for now I think! 
TTFN!

ps: I'm full because Darioush, my friend heather who's currently living with us and I went to a great vegetarian buffet place for supper tonight! I had all you can drink banana milk, and ate various chinese dishes, including yummy fried jiaozi (kind of like perogies). come visit and I'll take you there!

hello everyone! well, if the last few days are any indication, I seem to have kicked that nasty nausa habit and I am back onto food! pants are getting tight, but I haven't actually put on any weight yet....hmmm.....thats won't last long I imagine!

well, 12 days to Canada! only 5 days of school left! I don't know who is more excited, me or the kids! of course, probably me, because one week to a six year old may as well be a lifetime.

We moved house last week. We now live in a busy neighbourhood, near lots of restaurants and fun streets to walk on. We also have 3 bedrooms now, and it costs less! its quieter too, seriously, in my old compound, which was beautiful, the frogs and crickets kept me up at night!! 

thats about it for life in china right now....oh, except the heat and humidity is back!! killar. 

right, well, Zaijian!

guess I'll get some water! :)
If there was a smiling nausous little guy, that's be perfect :0)

the exertion needed to take a shower means you have to lay down and rest after!  

feewww...its hard work staying clean! :)

I just finished reading the novel "Angels and Demons" by Dan Brown (The Divinci Code guy)Its a page turner, like divinci code....same kind of story line actually (with a different plot, does that make sense?)It was written before "the code" actually, in in some ways I like'd it better! :) The ideas around science and religion are very interesting. There is also a character with the name "Chartrand" in it! Can't bet that! I read it in 3 days flat....which transleate in to one tired and cranky prego teacher for my poor students! I finished it as quickly as I could partly as a mercy to them! :) Now  can go to bed and wake up somewhat refreshed! (I hope!) I never know what the morning will bring...but then who does?

Good night all!!

Hello all! Well, I haven't been on any new trips, I haven't decided for sure where to have the baby, and school is school...it feels weird to be writing without anything "big" to say! :)But I will say this, ginger root tea (small chunks of fresh ginger and some "rock candy sugar" in boiled water quells nausea like nothing else! :) 

here's the update from my omniscient internet source:

Size
Your baby enters its second month of development, weighing no more than a chocolate chip or a berry. It's about five to thirteen millimeters long (less than half an inch), and weighs less than a gram (0.8g), or less than one-twentieth of an ounce.

(I think I'll call the baby "Chip" for now! :) Chip off the ol'block? Chip packs a powerful punch already, keeping me subdued and moving in slow motion! However, no actual...how shall I put this delicately?? Maybe I don't have to at all! ;) You already know what I'm talking about! :) 

Well, time for supper! :) "Kimchee" which is a Korean spicy cabbage dish/soup, with tuna! :)

My love at all! TTFN

Hello everyone!

well, I've check my what I'm sure is a very "authoritative" source on the internet and my baby is now the size of an m&m! delicious! 

and please don't worry, I do intend to visit actual professionals who know stuff about this, (maybe even went to school!) I won't just rely on the internet for all my pregnancy needs!! :)

TTFN!! :)

The honeymoon is over! 
After 3 years our couple is finally becoming a trio! Our baby's the size of a grain of sand, and looks more like a "dinosaur" (as one of my friend's kids said today)than a human but I'm already starting to feel the affects! :)
Anyway, I know everyone's first question seems to be "are you coming back to Canada?" and in all honesty we are not 100% sure yet. We're investigating our options right now! :) I'll still be coming home for a month in July, perhaps I'll be showing by then!!

Oh, by the way, it looks like a January baby! 

TTFN!

Happy Mothers Day! :)

I am finished updating the Jiujiang albums! Yeah!!

I also added 2 new pictures to my "shanghai" album. 

One is me modelling one of my new "tailor-made" items :0) Its the green capris with the "chinese buttons" at the bottom, if you can see :) The tailor is very good. She made me 2 capris and 2 dresses, and they have turned out quite well. I see her on Monday for (hopefully) the last fitting of my dress. 

The other picture is my "new look" Check it out! :) (me in red shirt)

I have been on the computer since 9 am! I am currently trying to "notify" everyone that I am finally back in action, but hotmail keeps having fits, and I've only gotten as far as "m" in my contact book! Hopefully I get it sent to you all today! :)

Hope you all have a fun Sunday!

Ahhh...the past few mornings I have been getting up nice and early, having a cup of green tea and reading...Such a peaceful way to start the day...

Today I go to pick up some clothes (or try on anyway) some clothes that my friend Inga and I had made by a tailor! Both of us are too big to buy many clothes here in Cgina (ie: we're "big boned" western girls! :)Inga is from Russia, by the way, and teaches grade one at the same school as me. Her daughter is in my class :) If you look in my photo album under school pictures you'll see a picture of her with me and my Chinese teaching partner by a Christmas tree. Her daughter is the picture of the girl with the russian book. 

I hope they fit! And look good!

A few weeks ago I went to a fabric market with Inga, and I bought material for 2 capris and 2 dresses! :) I think I may have gone overboard considering I've never had this done before, plus we don't know the tailor's work! :) Though we did contact her through a friend who was happy with her work! Fabric here is cheap. I spent about 30$ for all the fabric. But I'm not certain about the cost of the tailor. She is more expensive than some I know, but shes supposed to be good! 

I'll let you know how it works out! :)

I'll be biking to Inga's soon. I love biking, the feeling of being independant, and the exercise! Independace is sometimes hard here, what with not speaking Chinese. Its a good taste of what it must be like for people when they immigrate to Canada and don't know eng/french yet. Darioush has helped many friends who were new to Canada, and now its our turn I guess! :)

Right now the weather is great, its 20 C right now! (~8:30 am). Its supposed to get to 25 today. The humidity hasn't really hit yet, I guess in a few weeks it'll be an oven here again. 

Well, I'd better get outta here soon! 
Talk to you later!

So I'm captioning my photos now and I thought I'd explain one of the pics in the Jiujiang album. It's the one where Dar. and I are standing/sitting by some Chinese Characters. It says something like"real man's climb". Apparently when Chaing Kai Shek (leader of Kuomintang party) was there, he had some men carry him up the very steep part and said if they can carry him up, then they are "real men". Anyway, turns out we are "real men" (though I wasn't carrying anyone one my back!), though we are slow men :)

Hello everybody!

Today is a lovely day... I am currently reading "The Revelation of Baha'u'llah" series of books...they are amazing! The author mingles the early history of the Baha'i Faith and believers with conceptual and spiritual insights in to a masterpiece! (And I have never called any book a "masterpiece" before!:)  And now I am acually updating my journal for the 2nd day in a row!! its truly amazing! 

I've been working to get all my photos up on line, and when I do I'll be sending out "the call" to all. But will my dear friends and family trust again, after I have left them high and dry for so long?? Only time will tell... :)

One thing you'll notice if you do check out my photos is the ones of Lu Shan (Green Mountain) often look like they were taken in a mist...thats becasue they were! Once you got to a certain hright, it was quite misty. The tea grown on this mountain (basically every mountain in China boosts its own "famous" tea) is called the cloud mist tea, or something like that.

Well, I'd better get back to updating my photo album! In about an hour we're heading out to walk to my brother in law's place for dinner, usually a delicious cmobination of Chinese and Persian culinary feats. 

TTFN!

Hello folks!

The following is actually an exerpt from an email I just sent to a friend (Hi Brandi!)! But since I have not been very faithful to this journal, I thought maybe you'd all appreciate a little glimpse into the "angst" of teaching in China! :)  

Life here is good, very busy...I guess its all part of first year teaching! But actually, I think I'd be even busier in Canada, because I actually get more prep time...but its very different here..like other teachers are in my classroom when I'm not teaching, and I teach in other's classrooms, so I have an office I share with 12 other people...thats were I do my work. its not like in canada where you kind of make the classroom "yours". anyway, the challenge of teaching children who are just beginning to learn English is well..challenging! :) but the kids are sweet, and learning English fast, I think! its frustrating, we just don't have much materials to use...lots of internet searching, very poor access to good literature...I'm learning alot about being patient, flexible, and  working with whats avaliable. Also, I'm working within a school structure that I don't think best serves children's learning...I mean, grade ones have text books, and change teachers and subjects every 40 minutes...its definitely challenging for me, as I don't see this as ideal! However, as I would in any school I suppose, I'm learning how to work with parents (a little anyway) and finding my "style" and teacher's voice. This school is also new and open to change, but that will come with time...I'l do my bit and try my best to have a positive impact on the school...I'm not sure if my future plans include being in this school another year or not. 

China is really nice, I'm still struggling with language still of course...I really believe that the world needs to adopt one universal language - it could teach it as a second language all over the world. imagine going anywhere, and being able to communicate...I real step to world peace I think. at least, it wouldn't be so isolating to travel...but actualy, I'm very lucky, I have friends and family here, and have made friends with Chinese people wh speak english as well...

Ni Hao everybody!! I'm sorry I haven't written in sooo long!!! I've started work and I'm am just swamped with beginning of year stuff!! I'm really riding at the seat of my pants!

The other day I was taking a taxi and I heard beautfil music. It was a blind woman playing an erdu on the side of the road. It was so lovely...it rose over the morning sound of traffic like an angel on a breeze....(odd image?)

where do I even start with school? I can't..I don't have much time to write right now...I'll post some pictures later, and tell you more...there were ups and downs...culture shocks and challenges with language, system and lack of supplies...and rewards, spiritual, emotional and career-wise...

Darioush and I may be moving this weekend. We've looked around for a while, and have seen some nice places near my school, but there was one compound we kept going back to...hopefully we'll be moving very soon, and then I can walk to school!!

I hope to post again soon!!

Take care! Michelle

Ni Hao!

I just want to point out again that I have a site where I am posting pictures...I just posted one more (in Shanghai folder). Don't bother going unless you are excited to see what my new cell phone looks like!:) I'm excited because its my first! but I have to admit, its kind of sad having your first mobile, but not really having anyone to call you on it! :( I'll just have to remedy that quickly! Everyone here has a mobile, its actually cheaper than a landline! Landlines here you pay per minute when you call out, but its free to recieve calls. 

the site again is: http://mich09.bebo.com

What else can I say? I have been basically homebound this week, as we have had a private tutor coming everyday to tecah us mandarin, four hours a day. Our tutor's name (english name) is Sharon, Chinese name Lu Wei (thats surname Lu and first name: Wei)and she is a university student who is friends with Lily and Enayat (and now darioush and I!) She is very sweet, and helped me get my phone too! And she hooked me up into a phone plan that is normally just for Chinese people, so I'm paying really low rates too! 

I actually wrote a post about our Mandarin lessons a few nights ago, but lost it! Isn't that the worse...speaking of that, I'm going to post and then start another one! (just to be safe!:)

Okay, so a few of you have been asking now for pictures! I have created an online album at http://mich09.bebo.com Its a work in progress, the computer was working fine for awhile, but now its fighting my uploading attempts!
Its nice to know people are reading my page! Thank you for the loving , thoughtful, helpful comments!

So this is it! This will be one of the main vehicles through which I plan to "keep in touch" with all of you! I think this will be better than sending "mass emails" and I can post pictures, etc...I think anyway! I'll have to try! I think this is better because this way if you are interested, you can check it, if not, that okay too! :)

So...the current news is that Darioush and I are currently still in Winnipeg, though not for long! We sold our condo and will be in The Pas ASAP! We just have a few final details to take care of!

More Later!
